name: Ree Drummond's Queso Fundido
author: Pioneer Woman
summary: Throw in whatever ingredients you have on hand to make this delicious queso fundido. Serve with tortilla chips, carrot sticks, and cauliflower florets.
ingredients: 1  green bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1  yellow bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1 (8 ounce) package white Cheddar cheese, shredded
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Heat oil in a 9-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat
Add chorizo; cook, stirring to crumble, until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes
Transfer to paper towels to drain
Drain any excess fat from the skillet
Without cleaning the skillet, add bell peppers and onion
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until browned and softened, about 5 minutes
Remove skillet from heat and stir in tequila
Continue cooking vegetables, stirring often, until golden brown, about 3 minutes
Using a slotted spoon, transfer vegetables to a bowl
Stir together Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses in a bowl; spread 1/3 in the skillet
Add 1/3 of the vegetables, then 1/3 of the chorizo
Repeat with 2 more layers, ending with chorizo
Bake in the preheated oven until cheeses are melted and bubbling, about 8 minutes
Remove from the oven and top with tomatoes, cilantro, and salt
